We are recruiting to fill the position below:

title: Job Openings at Updeal Resources
content:
Updeal Resources is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Experienced Accountant

Job Location: Lagos

Job Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Overseeing the preparation of management accounts and periodic financial reports to support strategic decision-making.
	Monitoring and evaluating the financial performance of all organizational profit centres, identifying trends and advising on improvements.
	Ensuring compliance with financial reporting standards and strict adherence to reporting deadlines.
	Maintaining comprehensive financial records and implementing efficient document management systems.
	Providing high-level bookkeeping and advisory services to clients across various sectors.
	Supervising accounts receivable, accounts payable, and payroll processes to ensure accuracy and efficiency.
	Advising on and ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local regulatory requirements.
	Conducting detailed analysis of clients’ financial records, identifying discrepancies, and implementing corrective actions.
	Reviewing and approving bank and other reconciliation statements to ensure integrity of financial data.
	Overseeing the proper recording and classification of all issued and received invoices to ensure completeness and accuracy of accounting records.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or any related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of accounting experience.
	Must be a Chartered Accountant
	Working knowledge of basic accounting principles and practices.
	Working knowledge of relevant state, federal, and local regulations.
	Proficiency in MS Office and popular accounting software.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cvs to: updealcareers@gmail.com using "Experienced Accountant" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Tax Associate

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary


	As a Tax Associate, you will play a pivotal role in managing the tax-related responsibilities for our esteemed clients.
	You will be responsible for preparing and filing tax returns, ensuring strict compliance with tax laws, identifying opportunities for tax optimization, and supporting clients during audits.
	Your role also involves conducting thorough tax research, assisting in tax planning, and maintaining accurate financial records.
	Success in this position requires strong analytical skills, meticulous attention to detail, and proficiency in tax software.


Responsibilities


	Tax Preparation: Accurately prepare and file tax returns for individuals, businesses, and organizations while adhering to applicable regulations.
	Tax Compliance: Ensure clients’ adherence to local, state, and federal tax laws, avoiding penalties and maintaining compliance standards.
	Tax Research: Conduct detailed research on tax-related issues, enabling tailored advice and solutions for client challenges.
	Tax Planning: Assist in developing tax strategies to minimize liabilities and optimize financial results for clients.
	Audit Support: Provide clients with comprehensive assistance during tax audits and disputes, including documentation preparation and interaction with tax authorities.
	Record Maintenance: Maintain detailed and organized financial records to support tax filings and audits.
	Client Communication: Clearly explain tax strategies, obligations, and potential financial opportunities to clients, fostering strong relationships.
	Collaborative Engagement: Work collaboratively with senior associates, managers, and other teams to address complex tax scenarios and ensure seamless service delivery.


Education and Experience


	A Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or a related field, with a minimum of second-class Upper Division.
	1 - 3 years of practical experience in tax or accounting, preferably with one of the foremost professional services firms.
	Membership in a relevant professional body (e.g., ACA or ACCA) or possession of additional professional qualifications is an added advantage.
	Solid knowledge of accounting principles, tax regulations, and auditing standards.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and accounting software.
	Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills, with exceptional attention to detail.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: updealcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Audit Associate

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Responsibilities


	Assist in planning and executing internal audits, including operational, financial, and compliance audits across different departments and branches.
	Perform audit testing and document audit procedures in accordance with audit programs.
	Analyze business processes and identify control weaknesses, risks, and opportunities for process improvement.
	Prepare clear and concise audit documentation and reports outlining audit findings and recommendations.
	Follow up on previous audit findings and ensure corrective actions have been implemented.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	0 - 2 years of relevant audit or accounting experience; prior experience in logistics or supply chain is a plus.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and audit/accounting software.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: updealcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Full Stack WordPress Developer Job at Kumesoft Technology
content:
Kumesoft Technology - We are a growing digital marketing agency with a strong focus on SEO. Our mission is to help businesses grow by providing customized, results-driven SEO services that increase visibility, drive traffic, and boost conversions. Starting with high-demand markets, we offer country-specific SEO strategies (e.g., “Local SEO in Nigeria,” “Local SEO in Canada”) to meet the unique needs of each region. As we build our client base and revenue, we plan to expand into PPC, social media, and content marketing.

Our vision is to become a globally recognized SEO agency known for delivering high-quality, tailored solutions. Join us as we grow and shape the future of digital marketing.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack WordPress Developer
Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Full Stack WordPress Developer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate is a tech-savvy professional with deep expertise in WordPress development, front-end and back-end programming, server management, SEO, and automation.
	You will be responsible for building, customizing, and maintaining high-performance WordPress websites, ensuring optimal user experiences, performance, and security.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop fully responsive WordPress websites from concept to launch
	Create custom WordPress themes and plugins tailored to project requirements
	Transform Figma designs and wireframes into fully functional WordPress sites
	Utilize page builders such as Elementor, WP Bakery, Divi, Bricks, and Gutenberg
	Implement dynamic content using ACF and Crocoblock
	Manage cPanel/WHM, phpMyAdmin, FTP, and other hosting/server environments
	Perform manual site migrations and cloning, including database and file transfers
	Optimize website performance through caching, image compression, and best practices
	Implement robust security measures to prevent hacks, malware, and vulnerabilities
	Set up and manage WooCommerce stores including payment gateway integrations
	Handle SEO strategy, PPC campaign setup, and implementation of tracking pixels
	Build automated workflows including email (segmentation, tagging), SMS, booking systems, and more
	Leverage AI tools for content generation, design ideation, and workflow optimization
	Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve site errors and performance issues
	Document development processes and provide regular progress updates to stakeholders


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Proven experience as a Full Stack WordPress Developer (minimum 3+ years)
	Advanced proficiency in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, AJAX, and Python
	You must know how to write and use custom codes in some cases ( VERY IMPORTANT! )
	Strong knowledge of WordPress architecture, database management, and API integration
	Experience with automation tools and techniques (email marketing, booking systems, etc.)
	Skilled in SEO and PPC campaign management
	Proficiency with WordPress white labeling and plugin management
	Knowledgeable in transforming designs from Figma to WordPress
	Hands-on experience with website performance optimization
	Strong grasp of security best practices in WordPress development
	Familiarity with AI tools for development and marketing enhancement
	Strong communication skills and a commitment to clearly documenting work


Nice to Have:


	Experience with Git version control
	Familiarity with other CMS platforms (Shopify, Webflow, Wix Studio, Framer, e.t.c)
	UX/UI design sensibility
	Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.


What We Offer


	Salary: N100,000 - N180,000 Monthly.
	Competitive, based on experience.
	Flexible remote work
	Collaborative team environment
	Opportunities for skill development and growth
	Access to premium tools and resources
	Competitive compensation (Data).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter highlighting their relevant experience to: idoho.linksmanagement@gmail.com using “Full Stack WordPress Developer” as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Please only apply if you are a full-stack WordPress developer. If you only have WordPress experience (not full-stack), do not falsely edit your CV to claim full-stack expertise, as this will lead to a quick termination of the interview process
	We look forward to hearing from you!
    

    

        Click here to Apply
